definition: see 隕落|陨落[yun3 luo4]
to perish/to die
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: We honored the fallen police officer with a rifle salute.
sentences.chinese: 我們鳴來復槍向那名殞落的警官致意。

sentences.english: For the sun to rot, for the trees to drop.
sentences.chinese: 太陽腐灼，它從樹上殞落。

sentences.english: Now fame, it is fleeting, and stars, they keep falling.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，名望是短暫的，而星星們也不斷殞落。

sentences.english: Technology and entertainment are contributing to the fall of civilization.
sentences.chinese: 科技與娛樂加速了文明的殞落。

sentences.english: Falling, the star, flaming, the fire.
His bankruptcy announced the collective falling of the traditional business class.
sentences.chinese: 他的破產，宣告了傳統商人階層的集體殞落。

sentences.english: Saturn is fallen, am I too to fall?
sentences.chinese: 農神殞落了，我是否也將殞落？

sentences.english: Saturn is fallen, am I too to fall?
sentences.chinese: 農神殞落了，我是否也將殞落？

definition: most perfect song
to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
very powerful army
matchless/without equal/there is nothing better
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
to depart this life/to be no more
to decay/to decline/to become corrupt
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
changeable situation (idiom)
meteorite/falling star
magnificent feat/impressive feat/heroic undertaking/heroic attempt
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
lit. foul wind and bloody rain (idiom)/fig. reign of terror/carnage
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
